item.title: [508] Various Tutorials for Frequently Asked Questions [508]
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:1, topic:345991”]Once you have found the correct method, you will just need to add one if statement. if (ItemID == youritemid) { return levelrequirement; }All you need to do is replace ‘youritemid’ with the correct item id you want to add the requirement for, and ‘levelrequirement’ with the level needed to wield the item. Let me give an example:if (ItemID == 4151) { return 99; }This code would change the required attack level to 99 in order to weild the abyssal whip (4151).[/quote]

Not Judging your work, but couldn’t you do this without if statements, using a switch for example.#
such as this? not sure if its right, at work atm

getCLAttack(int ItemID) { switch (ItemID) { case 4151: return 99; case 88: return 99; default: return 1; } }

item.title: [508] Various Tutorials for Frequently Asked Questions [508]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[center][font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]508 FAQ Tutorials[/size][/font][/center]

Description: I have gone through the help section and found some of the (server sided) frequently asked questions about 508’s. I plan to answer as many as I can, and update often. If you have found a FAQ and think it should be posted here, post what it is with a link to a thread asking the question. If you have a question about or want a tutorial for:

[ul][li]Making yourself Admin[/li]
[li]Login Messages[/li]
[li]Adding objects[/li]
[li]Weapon special attacks[/li]
[li]XP rates[/li]
[li]Simple commands[/li][/ul]
then I suggest you check out Jc22493’s [508] Various Beginner Tutorials [508].

Difficulty: Varies

The Tutorials:

[ul][li][iurl=#itemreq]Changing items equip requirements[/iurl][/li][/ul]

[anchor=itemreq][center]Tutorial #1: Changing the level requirements for a player to equip an item.[/center]
This tutorial is used to change the level requirements a player needs to meet in order to equip a certain item. To begin, open Equipment.java in your Packets folder. The default levels that you can add a requirement for are: Attack, Strength, Defence, Ranged, and Magic. Some sources have others, but I will just show these. Ok, now what you need to do is search for: getCLSKILLNAME(int itemID) { in your file. Replace SKILLNAME with whatever level you want to add the requirement for (Attack, Defence, Range etc). For example, to add an attack requirement, I would search for: getCLAttack(int ItemID) { Once you have found the correct method, you will just need to add one if statement. if (ItemID == youritemid) { return levelrequirement; }All you need to do is replace ‘youritemid’ with the correct item id you want to add the requirement for, and ‘levelrequirement’ with the level needed to wield the item. Let me give an example:if (ItemID == 4151) { return 99; }This code would change the required attack level to 99 in order to weild the abyssal whip (4151).

I have to go, so I will write more later.

Read full topic
item.source: [508] Various Tutorials for Frequently Asked Questions [508]
